thread.title: Thiago Motta's car puts fan in hospital after PSG return home following devastating Champions League defeat to Barcelona
thread.title_full: Thiago Motta's car puts fan in hospital after PSG return home following devastating Champions League defeat to Barcelona

author: Jack Rathborn
title: Thiago Motta's car puts fan in hospital after PSG return home following devastating Champions League defeat to Barcelona
text:
Sport Thiago Motta's car puts fan in hospital after PSG return home following devastating Champions League defeat to Barcelona The Italy international's car was mobbed by angry fans at the airport upon returning from Spain after the 6-1 defeat Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Thiago Motta's car puts fan in hospital after PSG return home from Barcelona Share this video Get FC Barcelona   Thank you for subscribing!   
A car owned by Paris Saint-Germain star Thiago Motta has struck a fan to leave him in hospital following the devastating defeat to Barcelona in the Champions League. 
The Brazil-born midfielder did not feature at the Camp Nou but was picked up by wife Francisca upon arriving back at Paris Le Bourget airport. 
Irate PSG fans surrounded the Â£80,000-per-week star's Porsche following the team's capitulation in the 6-1 defeat that saw them shockingly dumped out of the Champions League despite their 4-0 first-leg lead. 
"Their car was surrounded by a gang of angry PSG fans, who were giving Motta a piece of their mind," claimed a witness. Sergi Roberto wheels away in delight after his winning goal (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) PSG players look distraught after blowing their first leg lead (Photo: Michael Regan) Read More 
"One of the fans was standing in front of the car, which lurched forward and hit him. He was taken to hospital. Other players were also being stopped as they tried to get home." 
Police have confirmed the man received medical attention in nearby St Denis for a back injury. 
French newspaper L'Equipe described the performance as 'unspeakable' on Thursday after yet another devastating blow to the Qatar-funded project. poll loading Was Barcelona 6-1 PSG the greatest Champions League match ever? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
